Уважаеми госпожи и господа,
 

Европейската комисия (ЕК) и доставчикът на услуги AggregateEU постигнаха сериозен напредък в последните месеци. AggregateEU (услугата за агрегиране на търсенето и съвместното закупуване, в рамките на Енергийната платформа на ЕС, в съответствие с Регламент 2022/2576 на Съвета) вече е отворена за записване, а фазата на агрегиране на търсенето ще започне скоро.

В подкрепа на всички дружества и компании, които желаят да участват в AggregateEU, ЕК организира среща на регионално равнище, която ще се проведе онлайн на 12 април 2023 г., от 10:30 до 12:00 ч. българско време, за да предостави актуална информация за AggregateEU и за допълнителните услуги, предоставяни наред с Aggregate EU - моделите на централен купувач (central buyer) и агент от името на клиента (agent on behalf). 

Организаторите са изготвили проект на дневен ред на срещата, както и документ с допълнителна информация за сътрудничеството между дружествата в рамките на AggregateEU, които прилагам. Също така е наличен линк към често задаваните въпроси - https://energy.ec.europa.eu/topics/energy-security/eu-energy-platform/aggregateeu-questions-and-answers_en.

Всеки желаещ да участва в срещата следва да попълни следното проучване на ЕС, в срок до 5 април 2023 г. - https://ec.europa.eu/eusurvey/runner/EU_Energy_Platform_RG_South_East_Europe, след което от страна на ЕК (DG ENER) ще бъде изпратен линк за участие във виртуалната среща, по време на която може да зададете въпросите си.

Бих искал да отбележа, че срещата ще се проведе на английски език и се очаква участието и на компании и дружества от Гърция, Румъния, Република Северна Македония, Молдова и Украйна.

 

С уважение,

Асен Захариев
 
Главен експерт

The EU Energy Platform - Regional Group meeting discussion paper
Company cooperation under AggregateEU
1. Objectives of the meeting
· Update industry on the practical aspects of AggregateEU mechanism, and
. Present options for company cooperation under the AggregateEU.
2. Opportunities under AggregateEU
AggregateEU is designed to match European buyers and sellers of natural gas. It creates new
opportunities for industrial players and gas companies to purchase LNG and pipeline gas. With
AggregateEU you may find competitive supply offers for up to 12 months with deliveries to National
Balancing Points or at two Virtual LNG delivery points. The system will go live in April and registrations
have already started.
What is new about AggregateEU is clustering of the demand of potential buyers per delivery point for a
given month and matching them with sellers. AggregateEU will offer additional security of supply,
transparency and enable industries, of different profile across Europe, to reach out to international gas
markets.

3. How you can participate - company cooperation under AggregateEU
You can participate in the demand aggregation as a single company or jointly with others. Minimum
value of demand to be placed by a single entity is 5 GWh at VTP and 300 GWh for Virtual LNG.
But if your demand is below the minimum threshold or if you want to limit practical challenges of
negotiations and delivery logistics, you may consider participating in one of the two company
cooperation models:
· Central buyer model (left figure) - one company registers, places aggregated demand, negotiates
and signs agreements on behalf of a group of buyers such as industrial consumers.
. Agent on behalf model (right figure) - agents provide services such as reservation of slots at LNG
terminals or transport from ship to point of consumption.

Companies are free to engage with other interested companies from their region or one of the 'agents
of behalf' and 'central buyers' - companies willing in providing such services can express their interest
here. , The European Commission, supported by national governments and industry associations, will
organise meetings to facilitate cooperation between companies in the coming weeks.
Company cooperation frameworks for the joint purchase of gas must be compliant with the EU
competition rules, which requires a self-assessment in line with Commission guidance1.
4. Additional information
The industry meeting of the Regional Group is complementary to the work of the Industry Advisory
Group (IAG), which is the Commission's expert group for technical discussions on horizontal issues
related to organisation of demand aggregation and joint purchasing of the EU Energy Platform.
Companies are approached by the authorities of Member State in which they are headquartered as well
as through industry associations. Participating companies are requested to register by via this link by
5 April: https://ec.europa.eu/eusurvey/runner/EU Energy Platform RG South East Europe and
share their questions regarding company cooperation two days ahead of the meeting with EU-
ENERGY-PLATFORM@ec.europa.eu.
